item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Whatever you are physically...male or female, strong or weak, ill or healthy--all those things matter less than what your heart contains. If you have the soul of a warrior, you are a warrior. All those other things, they are the glass that contains the lamp, but <i>you</i> are the light inside." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Dan Millman
item.description: "A warrior does not give up what he loves, he finds the love in what he does" -- Dan Millman

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Pittacus Lore
item.description: "I know what I'm capable of; I am a soldier now, a warrior. I am someone to fear, not hunt." -- Pittacus Lore

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Don Juan
item.description: "When one has nothing to lose, one becomes courageous. We are timid only when there is something we can still cling to." -- Don Juan

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Richard Marcinko
item.description: "Pain was their body's way of telling them that they'd pushed themselves to their limits -- which was exactly where they were supposed to be." -- Richard Marcinko

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Terry Masters
item.description: "Just because you don't like something doesn't mean nobody else will, and just because you can't see something, doesn't mean nobody else can." -- Terry Masters

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Don Juan Matus
item.description: "What we need to do to allow magic to get hold of us is to banish doubts from our minds. Once doubts are banished anything is possible." -- Don Juan Matus

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Don Juan Matus
item.description: "The hardest thing in the world is to assume the mood of a warrior. It is of no use to be sad and complain and feel justified in doing so, believing that someone is always doing something to us. Nobody is doing anything to anybody, much less to a warrior." -- Don Juan Matus

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by The Warrior Heir Cinda Williams Chima pg. 426
item.description: "They fought because they loved the dance, and the weight of a sword in their hands. The clash and spark of metal and hiss of flame was like music written just for them. They fought for glory, but not for blood. They were Weirlind, heirs of the warrior's stone. And they always slept better with blades beneath their beds." -- The Warrior Heir Cinda Williams Chima pg. 426
